title: Filing Phase
description: Learn filing requirements for party candidates at state and federal levels. Quiz performance converts into signatures and Candidate Coins (CC).

tasks.prompt: Read the Texas SOS Party Candidate Guide summary to understand nomination and filing rules.
Complete a quiz on state filing requirements (Texas SOS) and basic federal filings (FEC Forms 1 & 2).

questions.question: When must Party Candidates file their application of candidacy with the Texas SOS?
options: December of the year before the election
By early May of election year

questions.question: Who nominates Party Candidates in Texas?
options: Any registered voter in their district

questions.question: If you choose petition signatures, who can sign?
options: Voters who did not vote in another party’s primary
Anyone 18 or older, even if not registered

questions.question: Can you combine filing fees with petition signatures?
options: No, you must choose one or the other
Only if you have fewer than 1,000 signatures
Only with approval from your party chair

questions.question: What must accompany petition sheets for them to be valid?

tasks.prompt: Describe how you plan to secure your nomination and meet filing requirements. Your response will impact CC, signatures, and voter approval.
Summarize your filing strategy verbally using voice input.

narrator: As a Libertarian candidate, you must first secure your party’s nomination and then file with the Secretary of State. You may pay the filing fee with Candidate Coins, or — in the real world — collect signatures to appear on the ballot.
readingSummary: Party Nomination: Libertarians hold conventions; Democrats and Republicans hold primaries. Candidates must secure nomination before filing.
State Filing: Nominees file with the Secretary of State (SOS), either paying a fee (using CC in the simulator) or collecting signatures. Deadlines often fall in December before the election year.
Federal Filing: After state paperwork, federal compliance begins. Candidates must file FEC Form 1 (Statement of Organization) and Form 2 (Statement of Candidacy).
Record-Keeping: Accurate filings are crucial. Mistakes reduce CC and credibility; mastery earns signatures and boosts approval.
objectives: Learn filing deadlines and nomination rules.
Understand trade-offs between paying filing fees and gathering signatures.
chatFlow: Describe how you plan to secure your nomination and meet filing requirements. Based on your plan, I’ll narrate the impact on your CC, signatures, and voter approval.
sources: Texas Secretary of State Party Candidate Guide
